title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.18 | 08-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्रीगुरवेनमहा नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्य देशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवास अधी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chayiva Narottamam
Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 18th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
From this verse onwards, Kunti's prayers will continue till quite some number of verses.
So this is the beginning of Kunti's prayers to Krishna.
Krishna is about to leave for Dwaraka from Hastinapura.
And when Krishna is about to leave, Kunti approaches along with all the other members of the Pandavas family.
And Kunti offers prayers which are very, very enlightening about who is Krishna, what is his position, what is his absolute nature.
Very wonderfully explained in these prayers by Queen Kunti.
The meaning of this verse is, Shri Mati Kunti said,
O Krishna, I offer my obeisances unto you because you are the original personality and are unaffected by the qualities of the material world.
You are existing both within and without everything.
Yet, you are not the original personality.
So, Kunti's 1st prayer in the series of prayers,
she is offering obeisances to Krishna
as she knows Krishna is not just her relative.
Krishna is not just her brother's son, not just her nephew.
Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the original personality who is always transcendentally situated, unaffected by material qualities, even when he descends to this material world.
And one more thing she is telling here, Krishna exists both within and without everything, inside everything, outside of everything.
This is not easy to comprehend.
And, she is also telling, in spite of you being present inside everything and outside of everything,
still, you are not visible to everyone.
So, Srila Prabhupada has written an elaborate purport for this.
Let us try to hear from Prabhupada what he says.
So, Prabhupada begins his purport by telling,
Shri Mati Kunti Devi was quite aware that Krishna is the original personality of Godhead, although he was playing the part of her nephew.
See Krishna when he incarnates, he plays the part of a particular person and yet he remains the supreme personality of Godhead under all situations and circumstances.
His absolute position, supreme position does not change even though he may appear to be like Krishna.
Younger than Kunti Devi, subordinate to somebody else, but his supreme position is unchanged because he is the original personality of Godhead.
And Prabhupada further says, such an enlightened lady could not commit a mistake by offering obeisances to her nephew.
They should not commit a mistake.
The younger ones offer obeisances to the elders.
But here Kunti, elderly lady, she is offering obeisances to somebody who is younger, many many years younger.
So why? That is because Krishna is no ordinary person. He is the original personality of Godhead.
Devi is addressing Krishna as the original Purusha beyond the material cosmos.
We are all created beings within this material world.
Whereas Krishna exists beyond this material creation.
He is beyond this material creation.
And even beyond the material creation,
Though there are many many many liberated souls, devotees,
Krishna is the original Purusha, original personality, original Lord.
So that is Krishna's actual position.
Now Srila Prabhupada says one very important thing here.
Although all living entities are also transcendental,
They are neither original nor infallible.
We are also part of the spiritual world.
We belong to the spiritual world.
So we have our source in Krishna.
Krishna is always our eternal controller.
We are not infallible like Krishna.
Achyuta means one who never falls down from his transcendental position.
One who never comes under the clutches of Maya.
Krishna is the controller of Maya.
So he will never come under the clutches of Maya.
Means one who never falls down into this material existence.
He may appear to take birth like the son of Vasudeva and Devaki.
In the Bhagavad Gita this is explained in the fourth chapter.
What is the meaning of transcendental birth?
That even when he appears to take birth,
He is merely coming from the spiritual world to give darshan to all of us.
He is always present as the Supreme Lord.
In that same position he appears.
The living entities are apt to fall down under the clutches of material nature.
Whenever a living being who actually belongs to the spiritual world,
Or wants to try to become independent of Krishna's control,
Is forced to come under the clutches of material nature.
He is the Lord of all living entities.
He is the Lord of the material nature.
He is the Lord of the spiritual nature.
He is the Lord of Vaikuntha.
He is the Lord of this material creation.
He is the Lord of everyone and everything.
The chief among all living entities.
He is the chief eternal among so many eternals.
All the living entities are eternal.
But Krishna is the chief eternal.
He is the supreme eternal being.
He is the supremely conscious being among so many conscious living entities.
Now, Krishna is also addressed as Eeshwara.
Now, the living beings also may have some position of control.
In the Brahma Samhita it is said.
He is the controller of all controllers.
There is nobody equal to him.
Krishna was present before Kunti Devi and all the others who had assembled to,
Even though he is present in front of her,
He is also seated in her heart.
He is also seated in everybody's heart.
In the Bhagavad Gita this is confirmed.
How is it possible to understand this?
That is explained by Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita.
I am seated in everyone's heart.
So many subject matters are discussed in the,
Who is the ultimate source of everything.
Who is the ultimate controller of everyone and everything.
Is the compiler of the Vedas.
He is the knower of the Vedas.
This is the unique position of Krishna.
Even though Krishna was present outside,
The child in the womb of Uttara was in danger,
Krishna immediately entered the womb of Uttara,
from the attack of Ashwatthama's Brahmastra so Kunti Devi actually herself was puzzled is Krishna
all-pervading or is localized what do the meaning of all-pervading he is present everywhere but
actually localized means he's in a specific place particular place just like he's standing in front
of Kunti them in Hastinapura is present in front of Kunti so easy localized or easy all-pervading
so the answer is Krishna is both he is all-pervading is also localized but in spite of
being present every day he is standing before the Kunti Devi saying you would be some 20, 30 minutes
everywhere in spite of being present within everything in spite of being present outside
just like I can see you or you can see me like that everybody when Krishna incarnated could have
seen Krishna but still he reserves the right of not being exposed to persons who are not
surrendered souls those who are not surrendered when they see Krishna they see him as an another
ordinary person they seem as another ordinary person they cannot recognize oh here is the
supreme personality of God so how is it that they're not able to recognize that we expand
